title: Drawing, Two projects for a portable pulpit for the church in Offida, 1750–1800
title_raw: Two projects for a portable pulpit for the church in Offida
medium: pen, ink, light green water color and chinese black washes on paper
markings: Oval watermark with V over F
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Vertical composition of two altars. The altar on the left is shown from the front and the altar on the right is shown from the side. The left altar is supported by female gaines and has no canopy. The right altar has a canopy with lambrequins and is supported by columns. The altar on the left has the word "Prospette" written between the legs and the altar on the right has the word "Profilo" written between the legs. The bottom of the composition has the inscription: "Prospetto del pulpito por la Chiesa di Offida/Scala di palmi dieci romani." On the reverse, "p[er] / il pulpito."

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Two projects for a portable pulpit for the church in Offida, 1750–1800; Italy; pen, ink, light green water color and chinese black washes on paper; H x W: 39.9 × 26.6 cm (15 11/16 × 10 1/2 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors; 1901-39-2585
